faq.question: Can AI completely replace a research assistant?
faq.answer: No - AI excels at document processing, summarization, and data extraction, but can't replace human critical thinking, domain expertise, or complex analysis. The best strategy is using AI for repetitive tasks, freeing human assistants for high-value work.

faq.question: How much money can I save with AI?
faq.answer: Research assistants cost $18,000-36,000/year. AI costs $228/year for unlimited usage - save $17,772-35,772 annually (99% cost reduction). Even part-time assistants cost $500-1,500/month vs AI's $19/month.

faq.question: Is AI summarization as good as a human assistant's?
faq.answer: For initial screening and summarization, AI is often better - it's faster, more consistent, and never gets fatigued. Human assistants are better for complex analysis, critical evaluation, and tasks requiring domain expertise.

faq.question: What if I still need a research assistant?
faq.answer: Use both! Let AI handle document processing and summarization (saving 80% of assistant time), then use your assistant for high-value tasks like in-depth analysis, experimental work, and critical thinking. Better results at lower cost.
